article.title: A Space-Based Observational Strategy for Characterizing the First Stars and Galaxies Using the Redshifted 21-cm Global Spectrum

multiple_choice_question.text: Which letter corresponds to the redshift of the onset of reionization?
What do the red lines in the lower panel represent?
choices: Conservative estimates with Pop II stars only
A combination of Pop II and Pop III star formation

multiple_choice_question.text: What causes the transition from absorption to emission in the 21-cm spectrum?
choices: UV radiation from the first stars
X-ray heating from early black holes
The formation of the first galaxies

multiple_choice_question.text: The dashed and solid black curves differ in the assumed:
choices: Emission properties of Pop III stars compared to Pop II stars.
Efficiency of star formation in early galaxies.
Redshift at which the first stars appear.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the dominant source of foreground contamination in the 21-cm signal?
Approximately how much weaker is the 21-cm signal compared to the Galactic foreground?
What key characteristic distinguishes the 21-cm signal from the foregrounds, allowing for separation?
What is the approximate frequency range of the DARE observations?
What type of orbit will DARE utilize to make its observations?
What is the primary purpose of the thermal shield surrounding the DARE antenna?
choices: To protect the antenna from micrometeoroid impacts
To minimize temperature variations that could affect the antenna\'s performance
To enhance the antenna\'s sensitivity by focusing incoming radio waves
To shield the antenna from interference from the spacecraft\'s electronics

multiple_choice_question.text: What is a key feature of the DARE antenna design that helps to distinguish the cosmological signal from foregrounds?
choices: A very narrow field of view
The ability to operate at extremely high frequencies
Active cooling of the antenna elements

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of calibration system does DARE use to ensure the accuracy of its measurements?
What do the curves in the left and middle panels represent?
choices: Principal SVD signal modes for Pop II and Pop III star models.
The observed 21-cm signal from different regions of the sky.
The expected foreground contamination at different frequencies.
The instrument response function of the DARE telescope.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the primary goal of using SVD analysis in the context of 21-cm cosmology?
choices: To separate the weak 21-cm signal from the strong foreground contamination.
To identify the specific frequencies at which the first stars formed.
To determine the exact temperature of the intergalactic medium.
To map the distribution of neutral hydrogen throughout the early Universe.

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the color gradients in the matrices represent?
choices: The strength of the 21-cm signal at different redshifts.
The level of noise in the DARE observations.
The covariance between different signal and systematic parameters.
The probability of detecting a signal from the first stars.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does a high degree of covariance between signal and systematic parameters imply for the analysis?
choices: It makes it easier to distinguish between different models of the early Universe.
It increases the uncertainty in the extracted 21-cm signal.
It indicates that the instrument is not sensitive enough to detect the 21-cm signal.
It suggests that the foreground contamination is negligible.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which color represents the extracted 21-cm spectrum for a model with primordial Pop III stars?
What is the dominant source of uncertainty in the extracted 21-cm spectra shown in the figure?
choices: Covariance between the SVD signal and systematic modes

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the parameter ξα represent?
choices: The redshift at which the first stars formed.
The temperature of the intergalactic medium.
